data.name: RES_UnableToLoadConfiguration
data.value: Unable to load configuration from the XML configuration file: '{0}'. This can be caused by a number of problems, but the most common problem is an incorrectly configured Updater configuration file. The most probable sources of error are: missing nodes, incorrect attribute names, white space within attributes or within elements, white space between elements in the same sub-node, badly formed xml, or xml that does not conform to the ConfigSchema.XSD.

data.name: RES_InvalidServerXmlFile
data.value: The XML file downloaded from the server is invalid (or incomplete), the following XPath must be satisfied: '/configuration/appUpdater/availableversion'.

data.name: RES_InvalidClientXmlFile
data.value: The XML file on the client application is invalid (or incomplete), the following XPath must be satisfied: '/configuration/appUpdater/InstalledVersion'.

data.name: RES_ValidationException
data.value: The validation process fails with the following exception message: '{0}' validating the file '{1}' for the application '{2}'.

data.name: RES_ValidationFailed
data.value: The validation process failed for the file '{0}' within the application '{1}'.

data.name: RES_CantLoadAssembly
data.value: The assembly '{0}' can't be loaded. Check that the assembly uses the FULLY QUALIFIED NAME, which consists of the assembly name, version, culture, and PublicKeyToken.

data.name: RES_CantLoadTypeForAssembly
data.value: The type '{0}' can't be loaded within the assembly {1}.

data.name: RES_CantCreateInstanceOfTypeAssembly
data.value: Can't create the instance for the type '{0}' on the assembly {1}.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ProcessingApplication
data.value: Unexpected error processing application the '{0}', error message: '{1}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidServerXmlFileUpdateLocation
data.value: The downloaded server XML file defines a URI that is invalid--'{0}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidPathOnAppLauncher
data.value: The configuration file '{0}' defines an invalid path at the node client/appLauncher, the invalid value is '{1}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidPathOnBaseDir
data.value: The configuration file '{0}' defines an invalid path at the node client/baseDir, the invalid value is '{1}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidPathOnBaseDirMustBeRooted
data.value: The configuration file '{0}' defines an invalid path at the node client/baseDir, the baseDir path must be rooted, the invalid value is '{1}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidPathOnTempDir
data.value: The configuration file '{0}' defines an invalid path at the node client/tempDir, the invalid value is '{1}'.

data.name: RES_ClientXmlFileMustExist
RES_EXCEPTION_UsingDownloader
data.value: Unexpected error using the IDownloader of type '{0}' and from assembly '{1}' when a job was posted.

data.name: RES_InvalidServerFileName
data.value: The following file (to be downloaded as part of update) named '{0}' specified in the server XML (manifest) file is invalid.

data.name: RES_ErrorDownloadingJob
data.value: Error downloading files from the server for the application '{0}', the following message was in the exception: '{0}'.

data.name: RES_ErrorInitializingValidator
data.value: Error initializing Validator provider, type:'{0}', assembly:'{1}'.

data.name: RES_ErrorInitializingDownloader
data.value: Error initializing Downloader provider: type: '{0}', assembly: '{1}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidClientVersionInfo
data.value: Invalid client version info '{0}'.

data.name: RES_InvalidServerVersionInfo
data.value: Invalid server version info '{0}'.

data.name: RES_GeneralUpdaterError
data.value: A general error occurred updating the application '{0}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_CantRemoveMetadataFile
data.value: The metadata file '{0}' can't be removed.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_MetadataCantBeDownloadedOrNotValid
data.value: The metadata file (the Server Manifest) can't be downloaded for the application '{0}'. Either the manifest is unavailable (check download URL in Updater config file), the downloader failed, or the Manifest failed validation.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ServiceAlreadyRunning
data.value: The service is already running on this machine; please run only a single instance at a time.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ArgumentInvalidHexFormat
data.value: The string argument is an invalid format.

data.name: RES_FileNotDownloaded
data.value: The file '{0}' cannot be downloaded. The failure occurred in the synchronous download method. The Server Manifest must be downloaded using this synchronous technique. It may be that the configuration file's 'maxWaitXmlFile' is too short. Set it to at least 60,000 milliseconds (60 seconds; the value is expected to be in milliseconds). If you see this error repeatedly, it is probably because the wait timeout is too short, there are network problems, or the BITS service is not responding. It may help to restart the BITS service. It may also be that during debugging or under certain repetitive failures, the BITS services' "job queue" has become very large. In this case, the BITS job queue should be flushed using the BITS COM interface.

data.name: RES_BITSDescription
data.value: Updater: Download the Server XML File.

data.name: RES_BITSJobName
data.value: Updater job.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_CantCreateInstanceUsingActivate
data.value: Could not create an instance of the requested object in the Factory. Assembly = '{0}', Type = '{1}'. Check the configuration file--this is the most common source of this error. Assemblies must be specified by their FULLY QUALIFIED NAME, including name, version, culture, and public key token. Likewise, the TYPE that must be constructed must be specified by the FULL TYPE NAME, not just the class name. Type names are NOT necessarily just the "assembly.type" form; type names depend on namespace, which may or may not be the same as the assembly name.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_PollingIntervalTooShort
data.value: The polling interval is too short, it should be 60 seconds or more. Setting it to less can cause problems with locked files, and may produce race conditions in which manifests are downloaded while other files are still in process.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_CantLoadAssembly
data.value: The assembly and type specified could not be loaded. The assembly name given is '{0}' and the type name given is '{1}'. Check to be SURE that the FULLY QUALIFIED ASSEMBLY NAME with assembly, version, culture, and PublicKeyToken is specified. Check also that the type name is the FULL type name not the abbreviated type. It is common to have incorrect versions or PublicKeyTokens, validate these and correct the config. Likewise, the TYPE that must be constructed must be specified by the FULL TYPE NAME, not just the class name. Type names are NOT necessarily just the "assembly.type" form; type names depend on namespace, which may or may not be the same as the assembly name.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_UNCSourcePathToBITS
data.value: A UNC file path was used as the source for BITS downloading: '{0}'; this is invalid, source files for BITS must be URLs. Check the Server Manifest and be sure paths given to BITS as source paths are URLs.

data.name: RES_CouldNotFindCryptographicKey
data.value: The key passed to the Validator was null. Check to be sure that the XML path "validator/key" is correct and that the key node contains a valid cryptographic key for the type of Validator being used. A common error is to nest the key too deeply giving the Validator an unexpected XML structure. Other errors include: giving the wrong kind of key, encoding the key incorrectly, or omitting the key entirely.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_CouldNotDeserializeServerApplicationInfo
data.value: Could not deserialize an instance of ServerApplicationInfo: error message was '{0}'. The path to the Server Manifest was '{1}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_CouldNotDeserializeClientApplicationInfo
data.value: Could not deserialize an instance of ClientApplicationInfo: error message was '{0}'. The path to the Server Manifest was '{1}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_CantCreateInstanceFromFilePath
data.value: Could not create an instance of the type specified by its file name and interface to return. The file name given was '{0}' and the expected interface was '{1}'. Check the configuration file, and be sure that the path is correct. Also check that the assembly specified by path has at least one type that implements the given interface. Likewise, the TYPE that must be constructed must be specified by the FULL TYPE NAME, not just the class name. Type names are NOT necessarily always just the "assembly.type" form; type names depend on namespace, which may or may not be the same as the assembly name.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_BadTypeArgumentInFactory
data.value: When attempting to process a FULLY QUALIFIED TYPE AND ASSEMBLY NAME, there were fewer than FIVE total comma-delimited parts. Check the configuration file, and be sure that the type and assembly attribute contents are correct. The assembly must specify NAME, VERSION, CULTURE, PUBLICKEYTOKEN. Instead what was specified was: '{0}', '{1}', '{2}', '{3}', '{4}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_SettingUpDownloadDirectories
data.value: There was an error setting up the download directories; DownloaderManager was attempting to create the destination directories and had an exception. Check that the destination directories are reachable; that they are not locked; that the process has permission to access them; and that the paths given in the Updater configuration for this application point to directories which exist. The file source path causing the error was '{0}', and the destination path was '{1}'.

data.name: RES_TIEInBITS
data.value: The BITSDownloader was interrupted during a download by a ThreadInterruptException while downloading the file '{0}'. Usually this means the Updater was stopped in the middle of a download job and may simply mean the Service or other consuming application was stopped manually.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_DocumentNotValidated
data.value: There was an error during validation of the configuration file. The configuration file MUST pass validation according to the schema; please check that the configuration is well-formed and valid, and that it conforms to the XSD schema. Also avoid white space within elements. The validation message was: '{0}'."

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ErrorSavingClientApplicationInfo
data.value: Error while saving the ClientApplicationInfo object. This object corresponds to the 'AppStart.exe.config' file, and is used to update version and path information so that the 'shim' AppStart can find the newly updated application. The information passed in to Save this document was: '{0}','{1}','{2}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ConfigCantLoadInAUConstructor
data.value: SecurityException thrown while trying to register with ProcessExit event. Make sure the assembly/user have adequate permissions.

data.name: RES_StopUpdaterInterruptThread
data.value: DownloaderManager thread named '{0}' had to be interrupted; it did not respond in the allotted timeout to the stop event.

data.name: RES_RestartedUpdater
data.value: Restarted a DownloaderManager for the application '{0}' at date/time '{1}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_CheckingOnUpdates
data.value: Checking on updates for application '{0}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_StoppingIPP
data.value: There was an error when stopping the PostProcessor thread named '{0}'. It was interrupted and threw a ThreadInterruptException; the message returned was: {1}.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DownloadManifestStarted
data.value: DOWNLOAD STARTED: Downloading manifest for the application '{0}'. Time started: {1}

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_SourceFileName
data.value: SOURCE FILE: '{0}'

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DestFileName
data.value: DEST FILE: '{0}'

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DownloadManifestCompleted
data.value: Server Manifest successfully downloaded to location '{0}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_FilesMustBeUpdated
data.value: The local files must be updated for the application '{0}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DnldJobStatusUpdated
data.value: Status updated with job id '{0}' for the application '{1}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_NoNewVersionOnServer
data.value: There is no new version update available on the server for the application '{0}'

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DownloadingAppFiles
data.value: Manifest downloaded, now commencing download of application files for application '{0}' to destination temporary folder '{1}'

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_SettingUpFileForDownload
data.value: SOURCE: '{0}' DEST: '{1}'

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_ClientServerVersionCheck
data.value: The version currently on the client for application '{0}' is {1} and the version on the server is {2}.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_ValidatingFiles
data.value: Validating individual files for the application '{0}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_UpdatingLocalConfigFile
data.value: Updating the local configuration file, probably AppStart.exe.config depending on mode of deployment, for the application '{0}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_IPPWouldNotCast
data.value: Able to instantiate putative IPostProcessor, but it would not cast to IPostProcessor interface. The file path for IPP was '{0}' and the discovered type is '{1}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ThreadInterruptedException
data.value: The thread named '{0}' had to be interrupted.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_RunningIPP
RES_MESSAGE_ValidatingManifest
data.value: Validating the downloaded server Manifest file located at: '{0}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_ManifestFailedValidation
data.value: MANIFEST VALIDATION FAILED: The server Manifest located at '{0}' failed validation. It is being deleted; its signature did not match the signature of the file that was downloaded.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_FileFailedValidation
data.value: FILE VALIDATION FAILED: The file '{0}' failed validation. Stopping validation, deleting all files to prevent questionable files from remaining.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_FileValidated
data.value: '{0}' PASSED VALIDATION.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_SigningFile
data.value: Error signing the file at path '{0}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_SigningXml
data.value: Error signing xml.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DownloadComplete
data.value: Download Completed {0},{1},{2},{3},{4}.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DeserializingClientApplicationInfo
data.value: Reading the configuration file '{0}' to deserialize it into a ClientApplicationInfo object.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_SavingClientApplicationInfo
data.value: Now saving ClientApplicationInfo object to file '{0}'.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_DeserializeServerApplicationInfo
data.value: Reading Server Manifest file from '{0}' to deserialize into a ServerApplicationInfo object.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_ManifestFileNotDownloaded
data.value: The downloader failed to synchronously download a file with the path '{0}'. The cumulative error message generated during its attempts was: '{1}'.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_BITSBackgroundCopyError
data.value: The BITS service returned an error for the job with the ID '{0}'; the job's name and description are '{1}' and '{2}'. The BITS service error message for this job is '{3}'. This job has been canceled, and the DownloaderManager will attempt it again. If you see this error frequently, you may have a mis-configuration, or another administrator process/user is canceling BITS jobs. It is also possible that some mis-configuration of the Manifest file is causing BITS to have trouble with a source or destination path; be sure that all SOURCE paths are valid URLs, and that all DESTINATION paths are valid LOCAL UNC paths--__shares are not allowed__.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_BITSOtherError
data.value: The BITS downloader experienced an unexpected error. It may have been asked to check job status for a job ID that no longer exists, or a job that was canceled. The jobID was '{0}', the job name was '{1}', and the description was '{2}'.

data.name: RES_BITSFilesDownloadJobName
data.value: BITS_Files_Download_Job

data.name: RES_BITSFilesDownloadDescription
data.value: BITS_Files_Download_Job

data.name: RESX_MESSAGE_UpdaterStarted
data.value: The Updater has started; the target application's name is '{0}'. Time started: {1}.

data.name: RESX_MESSAGE_UpdaterStopped
data.value: The Updater is stopping updates for the application named '{0}'. Time stopped: {1}.

data.name: RESX_DateTimeToStringFormatLogFile
data.value: yyyy_MM_dd_HH_mm_ss

data.name: RESX_DateTimeToStringFormat
data.value: yyyy_MM_dd_HH:mm:ss

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_UpdaterLogDirectoryNotFound
data.value: The logging file's directory specified in the configuration file does not exist. The path given was '{0}'; please ensure that the log file's directory exists, or logging will not function.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_BaseDirMustExist
data.value: The configuration file at '{0}' contains an invalid value for the client/baseDir node. The path given for the client's base directory was '{1}'; this path does not exist. Be sure the baseDir exists on the client.

data.name: RES_MESSAGE_UpdaterLogCannotBeWritten
data.value: The Updater Log file located at '{0}' cannot be opened to write to. Check that the log file is in a directory that the user of Updater has access to, and be sure that the file itself can be created and written to by that user. Also be sure there's enough disk space to accomodate the log file.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_DuplicateApplicationName
data.value: The application name '{0}' is a duplicate. Application names must be unique to each Updater configuration file; if you wish to update multiple applications simultaneously, ensure that their names in the config file are unique.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_ErrorStopUpdater
data.value: There was an error while stopping the Updater. The application that was being stopped is named '{0}'. This error often occurs when multiple threads attempt to stop the update at the same time.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_UnauthorizedAccessFile
data.value: There was an error when attempting to access a file: '{0}'. The exception message was: '{1}'. Most often this occurs when the file that is being deleted/overwritten is marked "Read-Only"; be sure this is not the case, or the Updater will not be able to manipulate this file.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_UnauthorizedAccessDirectory
data.value: There was an error when attempting to access a directory: '{0}'. The exception message was: '{1}'. Most often this occurs when the directory that is being deleted/overwritten is marked "Read-Only"; be sure this is not the case, or the Updater will not be able to manipulate this directory.

data.name: RES_EXCEPTION_WaitedMoreThanTwicePollPeriod
RES_ExceptionInvalidExtendedFormatArguments
data.value: The extended format is invalid. Cache expiration time must be specified.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidConfigurationDocument
data.value: The configuration document is not a well-formed xml document.

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectMinutePart
data.value: The minute part must be an integer between 0 and 59.

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectHourPart
data.value: The hour part must be an integer between 0 and 23.

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectDayPart
data.value: The day part must be an integer between 0 and 31.

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectMonthPart
data.value: The month part must be an integer between 0 and 12.

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectDayOfWeekPart
data.value: The day of week part must be an integer between 0 and 6.
